Class dom.session.DObject 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.DObject
Subclasses:
ComponentDObject, LoadingDObject, TestDObject
public abstract class DObject
extends java.lang.Object
Root class for all distributed objects (objects that live the context of the multipoint group defined by the View class). This class defines the basic functionality for all distributed objects. It allows the containing View to have some guaranteed functionality (via combination of a classloader that guarantees that the local representation of this class is loaded from local disk and final methods in this class).

To create a new distributed object that is a subclass of this class, the programmer simply needs to

a) Write a valid subclass of this class;

b) Override any of the followng methods, as desired:

constructor: Called synchronously by View when the object presence is constructed.

initialized: Called synchronously by the DObject constructor setInitialState: Called synchronously by DObject constructor. Called with Serializable value from DObject class constructor final parameter activated(ViewNotifyInfo notifyInfo): Msg sent to DObject by the View (asynchronously) when the DObject has been activated.

deactivated(ViewNotifyInfo notifyInfo): Msg sent to DObject by the View (asynchronously) when the DObject has been deactivated.

otherActivated, otherDeactivated: Msgs sent to DObject by View to notify this DObject of the arrival/departure of other DObjects. Only sent if DObject subclass makes call to DObject.addDObjectListener().

requestCapability(CapabilityReceipt): Msg sent to us asynchronously by View to request a capability of us, on the behalf of a 'requestor DObject' that has initiated a request with us via its own sendRequestForCapability. In response to this message, subclasses can choose to provide capabilities to other DObjects, or not as dictated by the request.

receiveCapability(DObjectFacet): Msg sent to us asynchronously by View to give us a capability from another DObject. Override this to handle subclass-specific capability exchanges with other DObjects. Usually, this message will be sent by the View only if initiated by us with a call to sendRequestForCapability.

createClient(CreateClientInfo): Msg sent to us asynchronously by View to let us know that group membership has changed, and that we may wish to create a remote client on the new group member. DObject.createClient does create a remote client by default, but this behavior may be overridden by the subclass handling this message.

getClientClassName(SessionViewID id): This method is called by the DObject.createClient method to get the class name used to construct the remote client presence. Subclasses may override this to specify a particular class for this DObject's client presences

getStateForClient(SessionViewID id): This method is called by the DObject.createClient method to get the Serializable state to be sent to the client presence for initialization. Subclasses may override to specify any initial state for the remote client presence.

createClientDone(SessionViewID fromID, Exception e): Msg sent asynchronously from View to let us know that the remote client creation has completed (either successfully or unsuccessfully as determined by the value of the second parameter). Subclasses may override this to deal with this notification in any way desired.

c) use the View.createDObject method at run time to actually create the host presence of the new object. See the View.createDObject method for details

Note this class has a number of final methods. These are so that local runtime can guarantee that untrusted DObjects (that *must* use this class as it's superclass...guaranteed by construction) have certain contractually required functionality...since the View expects certain behavior out of the DObjects, then this class guarantees that it will get it.

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
View, createDObject, Closure
Source Code:
DObject.java

Constructor Detail

DObject

protected DObject(ViewDObjectFacet viewFacet,
                  DObjectID newID,
                  SessionViewID homeID,
                  java.net.URL codeBase,
                  java.io.Serializable params) throws java.lang.InstantiationException
This constructor is declared protected so that only a) subclasses and b) the View class (within this package) can use it. This makes it impossible for hostile code (guaranteed not to be from this package), from creating valide (according to the View) instances of DObject's directly.
Parameters:
viewFacet - a ViewDObjectFacet that defines our local runtime context. If this parameter is null, an InstantiationException is thrown.
newID - a DObjectID that is the new id for this DObject. If this parameter is null, an InstantiationException is thrown.
homeID - a SessionViewID that is the home view id for this DObject If this parameter is null, an InstantiationException is thrown.
codeBase - an URL that identifies the (local or remote) codebase for this DObject. This parameter may be null.
params - an Object that is used to initialize any subclasses
Throws:
java.lang.InstantiationException - is thrown if any of the critical parameters are null.
Method Detail

initialize

protected void initialize() throws java.lang.InstantiationException
Initialize this instance. This is called in the DObject constructor, and it allows subclasses to call arbitrary initialization code. The implementation for this class is to do nothing, as all critical initialization is done within the DObject constructor
Throws:
java.lang.InstantiationException - can be thrown if some problem with initialization

setInitialState

protected void setInitialState(java.io.Serializable params) throws java.lang.InstantiationException
Set initial state. This method is called inside the constructor for DObject instance (host and client), and is passed the Serializable last parameter. If this is a client, the host method 'getStateForClient' determines what the parameter actually is, and is sent over the wire in the construct message. For this superclass, the implementation of this method is to ignore the client state, because the above implementation of 'getStateForClient' simply provides null. Subclasses that override this method should also probably override the 'getStateForClient' method.
Parameters:
params - the Serializable object that is passed to this method by the constructor. For this superclass, the value of params is null.
Throws:
java.lang.InstantiationException - can be thrown if some problem with setting the initial state
See Also:
getStateForClient

getID

protected final DObjectID getID()
Get the DObjectID identity for this DObject. Declared final so that local View can guarantee that the identity that was set on construction is used in subsequent calls to getID(). Guarantees that once the relationship is defined between a DObjectID and a DObject (upon construction) that the local View and all other views in the group can use the DObjectID as a unique key for the DObject instance. NOTE: DObjectID is opaque, and currently is just a GUID. It could and should be something more substantial...i.e. a certified SturdyRef or etc...basically it could be an identity with all the functionality of the microcosm identity ingredient.
Returns:
DObjectID that uniquely identifies this DObject.

getHomeID

protected final SessionViewID getHomeID()
Get the SessionViewID identity for this DObject's 'home' View. Declared final to guarantee that the 'home' identity set on construction is used in subsequent calls to getHomeID().
Returns:
SessionViewID that uniquely identifies this DObject's 'home' view

getCodeBase

protected final java.net.URL getCodeBase()
Get the url that identifies the codebase for this DObject. This is declared final so that the local view can guarantee that this code is executed when called.
Returns:
URL the URL that represents the codebase for this DObject

getSessionView

protected final ViewDObjectFacet getSessionView()
Get the View known to this DObject. Declared final so that local view can guarantee that the View set on construction is used in subsequent calls to getSessionView().
Returns:
the ViewDObjectFacet that is the facet to the local view for this DObject

getViewID

protected final SessionViewID getViewID()
Get the View id where this instance of the DObject is. Does not have to be the same as the home id...if not, this is a client instance.
Returns:
SessionViewID that is the id for the local View

getAccessFacet

protected final DObjectViewFacet getAccessFacet() throws NullFacetException
Get the DObjectViewFacet for this DObject. This method is called by the local view to get an initial facet for the DObject being created. It allows the local view to have an appropriate level of control (defined by the DObjectViewFacet semantics) over the DObject being created (i.e. the DObject can be removed, deactivated, etc., etc.).
Returns:
DObjectViewFacet that allows the local View to appropriately manipulate this DObject
Throws:
NullFacetException - thrown if facet not accessible

isClientPresence

protected final boolean isClientPresence()
Determine whether this instance of this DObject is currently a client or a host presence. Declared final so that local view can guarantee that this code is executed when isClient is called.
Returns:
true if this instance is a client presence, false otherwise.

revokeAccessFacets

private void revokeAccessFacets()
Revoke our view access facet. This is called when this object gets notification that it has been destroyed. It nulls out any reference to this DObject to allow it to be garbage collected.

receiveAsynchViewMsg

protected final void receiveAsynchViewMsg(ViewDObjectFacet viewFacet,
                                          Closure closure)
Receive an asynchronous message from the local View. This is declared final so that the local View can guarantee the behavior of this method. This method should enqueue the given Closure on some run queue for later execution. It should not execute the given Closure directly.
Parameters:
viewFacet - the ViewDObjectFacet sending the message
closure - the Closure representing the message

receiveSynchViewMsg

protected final void receiveSynchViewMsg(ViewDObjectFacet viewFacet,
                                         Closure closure)
Receive a synchronous message from the local View. This is declared final so that the local View can guarantee the behavior of this method. This method should execute the given Closure synchronously. NOTE: NOT CURRENTLY USED. ALL MESSAGES FROM VIEW ARE CURRENTLY DELIVERED ASYNCHRONOUSLY
Parameters:
viewFacet - the ViewDObjectFacet sending the message
closure - the Closure representing the message

                                          Closure closure)
This will be the handler for all messages sent to us asynchronously through the DObjectFacets that we provide. Haven't finished this yet, but it will likely look very much like the receiveAsynchViewMsg...

activated

protected void activated(ViewNotifyInfo notifyInfo)
Subclass overrideable notification that this object has been activated. This is sent by the DObject.activated method (asynchronously). The default implementation is to do nothing.

deactivated

protected void deactivated(ViewNotifyInfo notifyInfo)
Subclass overrideable notification that this object has been deactivated. This is sent by the DObject.deactivated method (asynchronously). The default implementation is to do nothing.

otherActivated

protected void otherActivated(DObjectID otherID)
Message sent from View to us if we have explicitly asked to be registered as a listener for other DObjects via the addDObjectListener call. This message will be sent to us by the View whenever a DObject has been activated. Subclasses will probably choose to override this so they can respond to this message, if they call addDObjectListener.
Parameters:
otherID - the DObjectID of the DObject that has been activated
See Also:
addDObjectListener

otherDeactivated

protected void otherDeactivated(DObjectID otherID)
Message sent from View to us if we have explicitly asked to be registered as a listener for other DObjects via the addDObjectListener call. This message will be sent to us by the View whenever a DObject has been deactivated. Subclasses will probably choose to override this so they can respond to this message, if they call addDObjectListener.
Parameters:
otherID - the DObjectID of the DObject that has been deactivated
See Also:
addDObjectListener

receiveDataFromRemote

protected final void receiveDataFromRemote(SessionViewID fromID,
                                           Data data)
This message is sent to us by the view when we have received some data from one of our remotes. This is the central point for the handling of all data from our remote presences, and is declared final to guarantee functionality.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID of the view where our presence sent this data from
data - the Data that was sent to us
See Also:
handleDataFromRemote

handleDataFromRemote

protected void handleDataFromRemote(SessionViewID id,
                                    Data data)
Method called by receiveDataFromRemote when a remote presence has sent us some data, it's not a Closure to be executed, but rather is some other data. Subclasses may override as appropriate to deal with message as appropriate.
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID the data are from
data - the Data sent to us
See Also:
receiveDataFromRemote

sendDataToRemote

protected final void sendDataToRemote(SessionViewID toID,
                                      Data data) throws java.io.IOException
Send the given Data to the remote view specified. If the view specified is null, the Data is sent to all remote presences.
Parameters:
toID - the SessionViewID we are directing the Data to. If null, it means that Data is directed to all known presences
data - the Data to send
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem with queueing the message

sendClosureToRemote

protected final void sendClosureToRemote(SessionViewID toID,
                                         Closure code) throws java.io.IOException, java.io.NotSerializableException
Send the given Closure object to the given remote view identified by the toID parameter. The first parameter may be null (which means all remotes will receive the Closure).
Parameters:
toID - the SessionViewID we are directing the Closure to. If null, means Closure is directed to all known presences
code - the Closure to send
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if some problem with queue the message
java.io.NotSerializableException - thrown if some parameters in the Closure are not declared to be Serializable
See Also:
dom.closure.Closure

receiveClosureFromRemote

protected void receiveClosureFromRemote(SessionViewID fromID,
                                        Closure code)
Receive and execute a Closure sent to us from one of our remotes. Simply calls runClosure with the given Closure.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID where our presence sent us the Closure from
code - the Closure to run
See Also:
receiveDataFromRemote, runClosure

createClient

protected void createClient(CreateClientInfo notifyInfo)
Msg received when our local view gets a new group member and notifies us that we may want to create a remote client presence of ourselves. This method sends a 'create client' message the new remote View to ask it to create a client presence on our behalf. The remote View may refuse, or the creation may fail for some other reason, but if so, we will hear back via the createClientDone msg (below).
Parameters:
notifyInfo - info provided by the local view. This at least contains the remote's SessionViewID so that we can direct messages to it
See Also:
addNewDObject, createClientDone

getDataToCreateClient

private CreateDObjectData getDataToCreateClient(SessionViewID id)
Create an instance of a CreateDObjectData for delivery to remote LoadingDObject instance. Essentially, the CreateDObjectData instance represents the state of this DObject for use in remote client construction. It is called from the createClient method. Subclasses can override this to provide whatever data they wish for creating a remote client.
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID where the client will be created
See Also:
createClient

getClientClassName

protected java.lang.String getClientClassName(SessionViewID id)
Get class name of class to use for client creation. By default, this returns the same class name as this object, but subclasses may override to use any class desired for the remote client presence of this object (!).
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID where the client will be created (not currently used)

getStateForClient

protected java.io.Serializable getStateForClient(SessionViewID id)
Get state of this DObject for delivery to new client. The resulting object must implement the Serializable interface, as it will be sent over the wire to the remote client for initialization.

NOTE: Subclasses should never allow this to be called on a client DObject instance. It should only be called on the current host.

Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID of the view where the client is being constructed
Returns:
the Serializable object that contains the state to be sent to the new client. This object will be passed into the constructor of the remote client (last parameter) during the construction of the instance.
See Also:
loadDObject, LoadingDObject, setInitialState

getStateForTransfer

protected java.io.Serializable getStateForTransfer(SessionViewID newHomeID)
Get state of this DObject for delivery to client that will serve as new host. The object returned from this call must implement the Serializable interface, as it will be sent over the wire to the remote (formerly a client) that will serve as the new host.

NOTE: Subclasses should never allow this to be called on a client DObject instance. It should only be called on the current host.

Parameters:
newHomeID - the SessionViewID of the view where the new host will be
Returns:
the Serializable object that contains the state to be sent to the new host. This object will be passed into the 'setStateFromTransfer' method of the remote client.

setStateFromTransfer

protected void setStateFromTransfer(java.io.Serializable newState)

createClientDone

protected void createClientDone(SessionViewID fromID,
                                java.lang.Exception e)
Message received from remote presence when the remote client creation is completed. The remote sends a Closure with this method to this presence and we then get the message. If the Exception is null, it means everything went OK. If non-null, it represents the problem that was encountered during creation. Subclasses can override this to do specific things in response to this event.
Parameters:
fromID - the SessionViewID that was creating a client presence
e - the Exception resulting from the remote client create request. If null, the client was created properly. If non-null, identifies problem encounted in remote creation.

recycleHost

protected final void recycleHost() throws PresenceException
Permanently destroy this DObject host. This is the interface that subclasses may use to make this DObject (and all its client presences) permanently go away. This method may only be successfully called from the host presence. If called directly on a client presence, it will throw a PresenceException.
Throws:
PresenceException - thrown if this method is called on client presence

recycleClient

protected final void recycleClient() throws PresenceException
Message from host to client to tell it to go away. This is the message handler for the client, so that hosts can send the recycle message.
Throws:
PresenceException - thrown if this presence is not a client

requestCapability

protected void requestCapability(CapabilityReceipt receipt)
Method called by View (only) to deliver a request for capability from another DObject. This method is sent asynchronously by the View#requestDObjectCapability method so that we have a chance to receive the request, make a decision about whether to respond to the request, and then send this receipt *back* to the View so that it can deliver it to the original requestor (via the ViewDObjectFacet#receiveCapability method). Subclasses should override this as appropriate to provide capabilities exchange semantics as needed. In response to this message, if the receive wishes to respond positively to the request it should: a) Create an instance of a DObjectFacet (or some subclass) b) Call the receipt.setFacet(DObjectFacet) method to set the facet for the given receipt c) Call the getSessionView().receiveCapability(receipt) method.
Parameters:
receipt - the CapabilityReceipt from the View
See Also:
requestCapability, requestDObjectCapability, receiveCapability, giveDObjectCapability, receiveCapability

getDefaultDObjectFacet

protected DObjectFacet getDefaultDObjectFacet(DObjectID requestor)
Get the default DObjectFacet for this DObject. This is called from the requestCapability method, in case we are asked for a capability, and the subclass does not handle it. For a default DObjectFacet (one that is given out in response to any request), what this does is construct a DObjectFacet that exposes any public methods declared by subclasses as asynchronously invokable by the receiver of this facet. Subclasses are free to override to return (e.g.) nothing, or some other default facet policy.
Parameters:
requestor - the DObjectID of the object making the request
Returns:
DObjectFacet that is the default facet for this DObject

receiveCapability

protected void receiveCapability(DObjectFacet aFacet)
Method called by View (only) to respond to *our* request for a capability from another DObject (via ViewDObjectFacet.requestDObjectCapability)
Parameters:
aFacet - DObjectFacet that View is returning to us from the grantor Can be null, if grantor does not wish to give anything back to us.
See Also:
receiveCapability, giveDObjectCapability

sendRequestForCapability

protected final void sendRequestForCapability(DObjectID id,
                                              java.lang.String requestName,
                                              java.lang.Object data) throws java.lang.Exception
Entry point method for subclasses to issue requests of other DObject instances for capabilities. This can be used by DObject subclasses to send an asynchronous request for a capability to another DObject presence (within same view), via the local (trusted) View. Sure, subclasses could call getAccessFacet() themselves and send the message directly, but this method makes it easier on them ;-).
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the DObject we wish to make the request of (grantor)
requestName - the request name (cannot be null)
data - any Object representing data specific to the request
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown under a variety of different conditions
See Also:
requestCapability, requestDObjectCapability, requestCapability, receiveCapability, giveDObjectCapability, receiveCapability

getViewFacet

protected final BaseFacet getViewFacet(java.lang.String request,
                                       java.lang.Object data)
Generic meta-interface for DObjects to get facets on the local view. This interface can be used to make arbitrary requests of the local view securely. The untrusted subclass of this class cannot call the view.getViewFacet method directly, but rather only through this call.
Parameters:
request - a String identifying the desired service from the view
data - arbitrary data associated with the request
Returns:
BaseFacet that is a facet on the local view. Can be null if view does not wish to provide a facet for the service.

addDObjectListener

protected final void addDObjectListener()
Interface to request from the View that we be notified of the arrival and departure of other DObjects. This will be used by subclasses that wish to 'know' of the arrival and departure of other DObjects (so that interaction can begin). As a result of calling this method (e.g. in the constructor), the subclass of this class will then start receiving asynchronous notifications from the view of the activation and deactivation of other DObjects. It can do as it wishes with these notifications.
See Also:
otherActivated, otherDeactivated, addDObjectListener, removeDObjectListener

removeDObjectListener

protected final void removeDObjectListener()
Interface for removing ourselves as listeners for the arrival/departure of other DObjects.
See Also:
otherActivated, otherDeactivated, removeDObjectListener

runClosure

protected void runClosure(Closure closureToRun) throws java.lang.Exception
Run (execute) a given closure for this object.
Parameters:
closureToRun - the Closure object to run
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if some problem running the given closure
See Also:
executeThisClosure

sendClosureToHost

protected void sendClosureToHost(Closure closure) throws java.io.IOException, java.io.NotSerializableException
Utility function to send the given Closure to our host. If this code is called by the host instance, it is ignored. Simply a wrapper for sendClosureToRemote, with first parameter set to this DObject's homeID.
Parameters:
closure - the Closure to deliver to the host
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if we are not connected
java.io.NotSerializableException - thrown if some parameters in the Closure are not declared to be Serializable
See Also:
sendClosureToRemote

sendClosureToRemotes

protected void sendClosureToRemotes(Closure aClosure) throws java.io.IOException, java.io.NotSerializableException
Utility function call sendClosureToRemote with null parameter, which means that it will be delivered to all other presences.
Parameters:
aClosure - the Closure to deliver to remotes
Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown if we are not connected
java.io.NotSerializableException - thrown if some parameters in the Closure are not declared to be Serializable
See Also:
sendClosureToRemote

handleMessageException

protected void handleMessageException(Closure aClosure,
                                      java.lang.Throwable aThrowable)
Handle an exception generated during our own message processing. This allows this DObject some flexibility in dealing with exception conditions
Parameters:
aClosure - the Closure that generated the exception
aThrowable - the Throwable generated

dumpStack

protected void dumpStack(java.lang.Throwable e,
                         java.lang.String location)
Utility method for use by all DObjects and subclasses to dump the stack. This gives a single point for debugging output.
Parameters:
e - the Throwable being reported (can be null)
location - a String that is also put out to debugging output

debug

protected void debug(java.lang.String message)
